questions.q: Switzerland is famous for its neutrality in international conflicts. This policy has been maintained since which century?
Japan's economic miracle in the post-WWII period is often called the ____ Boom.
Brazil is home to the world's largest ____ forest.
Which country has the most official languages in the world?
The Nordic model of social democracy is ____ by countries like Norway and Denmark.
Australia is the only country that is also a ____.
New Zealand was one of the last major landmasses to be ____ by humans.
Egypt's economy ____ heavily on tourism and the Suez Canal revenue.
Canada shares the world's longest international border with which country?
South Korea's rapid industrialization transformed it from a developing nation to a ____ economy.
Portugal is one of Europe's oldest nation-states, with borders established in which century?
India's IT sector has made it a global hub for ____ and software development.
Mexico City is built on the ruins of which ancient Aztec city?
The Netherlands has ____ below sea level, protected by an extensive dike system.
Iceland's energy comes primarily from ____ and geothermal sources.
